events.description: Events.com is a global event management platform that empowers organizers to plan, promote, sell, and execute live, virtual, and hybrid events using a suite of modern, integrated tools. The platform supports everything from ticketing and sponsorships to marketing, data insights, and on-site execution — helping creators deliver exceptional event experiences. At Events.com, I work as a Front-End Engineer contributing to the development and maintenance of scalable, user-focused web applications using React and TypeScript. My key responsibilities and achievements include: Collaborating with cross-functional teams to build and maintain modern, responsive, and accessible applications that support the full event lifecycle. Implementing reusable UI components and design patterns, ensuring consistency across the platform and contributing to the evolution of the company’s design system. Optimizing performance and SEO, applying best practices to improve loading speed, accessibility, Core Web Vitals, and overall discoverability. Supporting the development of new features across multiple product areas, including event discovery, ticketing flows, and organizer tools.

citifyd.description: Citifyd connects drivers with parking providers and local businesses, reducing costs, increasing revenue, and energizing local commerce by simplifying urban mobility. The platform makes it easier for drivers to find and purchase parking, for parking providers to offer available spaces, and for nearby businesses to attract customers locally. At Citifyd, I worked on the maintenance and development of new features using front-end technologies such as React and Next.js. My contributions included the incremental migration of the Parking Provider Dashboard from legacy AngularJS to React to ensure long-term maintainability while keeping the system fully operational, the implementation of a reusable component library in TypeScript using Storybook with accompanying unit tests, the development of a B2B-focused website with a strong emphasis on SEO using Next.js, CSS Modules, and modern front-end practices, and the creation of dashboard features such as dynamic event-based pricing, enabling automatic price adjustments based on transaction volume and time remaining until events.

suitable.description: Suitable is a management system for restaurants. Its main product is a customized web application for each establishment, allowing them to offer an efficient ordering experience to customers while avoiding platform fees like iFood. The system also includes its own bot for WhatsApp (the most popular messaging platform in Brazil) that directs the user to the restaurant's app and sends automatic updates on the order status. During my time at the company, there was no development of new features, bug fixing, or refactoring of the restaurant's control panel code, developed in React. I also participated in the complete rewriting of the website, migrating from PHP to Next.js.

projects.mundoEscape: Mundo Escape is a Brazilian platform created by me for the escape game community. The site lists escape rooms across Brazil and allows players to share detailed reviews based on core escape game criteria, helping others choose their next experience. As escape room enthusiasts, we built Mundo Escape to strengthen the community and make it easier for players to discover and evaluate new rooms. The platform also helps players connect with each other. You can register your interest in playing a specific room on a certain date, and Mundo Escape matches you with other players who want to play the same room at the same time. For escape game owners, the platform offers tools to register room records and define ranking rules, such as whether hints are allowed, so the site can generate fair and transparent leaderboards of the best times for each room.

whatIsEscapeGame.title: What is an escape game?
whatIsEscapeGame.description: An escape game (or escape room) is a live, team-based experience where players are placed in a themed environment and must solve puzzles, find clues, and complete challenges within a set time limit to achieve a goal, usually escaping the room. It combines logic, teamwork, storytelling, and immersion into a unique interactive experience.

projects.siteCarro: Site Carro is a complete platform for car dealerships that want a professional online presence, higher sales, and more time for their day-to-day operations. Created by me, the platform was built to make it easy for dealerships to create their website in minutes, register vehicles by entering only the license plate, and automatically publish listings on social media. Designed to simplify dealership workflows, Site Carro automates repetitive tasks, reduces listing errors, and helps dealerships reach more customers with attractive, well-presented vehicle ads. All of this in a fast, responsive, and easy-to-manage system, no technical knowledge required. Whether you’re just starting out or looking to further professionalize your dealership, SiteCarro provides the ideal tools to turn vehicles into real online sales opportunities.
